place.name: STEYNTON
place.gazetteerText: STEYNTON, a village and a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke. The village stands 2 miles NN E of Milford r. station; and has a post-office under Milford-Haven. The parish includes part of Milford town, and 305 acres of Milford-Haven foreshore. Acres, 7,275. Real property, £12,679. Pop., 3,710. Houses, 663. St. Botolphs and Castle Hall are chief residences. There are some old forts. The living is a vicarage, annexed to Johnstone. The church is ancient. The p. curacy of Milford-Haven is a separate benefice. There are two endowed schools. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
